section: Two Ways to Write and Run Python Code
text:
Two Ways to Write and Run Python Code
There are two main ways you can program in Python for this course:

Anaconda (Recommended): simple, all-in-one installation.

Google Colab: online and quick, but limited control.

title: Practicum Process Technology: Anaconda - Python Setup
text:
Option 1: Anaconda (Recommended)



Anaconda is the easiest and most reliable way to get started with Python for data and scientific applications.
It includes:

Python, Jupyter Notebook, and Spyder (ready to use)
A built-in package and environment manager (Conda GUI)
Pre-installed scientific libraries (NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib, etc.)



We recommend Anaconda for most students to ensure a smooth start.

title: Practicum Process Technology: Anaconda - Python Setup
text:
Option 2: Google Colab (Alternative)



If you cannot install software locally or you run into issues, you can use Google Colab:

It runs completely in the browser

Requires only a Google account

No Python installation needed

Lets you upload notebooks or open them directly from GitHub

Already includes most common Python packages (NumPy, pandas, matplotlib, etc.)

title: Practicum Process Technology: Anaconda - Python Setup
section: Follow these steps to install Anaconda on your system:
text:
Follow these steps to install Anaconda on your system:
Step 1:
Install Anaconda from the official website: Anaconda Distribution
Step 2:
Follow the installation instructions for your operating system (Windows, macOS, or Linux).
Step 3:
Once installed, launch Anaconda Navigator.
Step 4:
From Anaconda Navigator, you can launch your favorite IDE (Integrated Development Environment) such as Jupyter Notebook, VS Code or Spyder.
